page.title: 09BURGHLEY:DAIRY FARM
page.content: When we arrived at the cottage.It was windy but bright and warm.We could see that the land was covered with scattered trees and crops.When we walked through the arch. We could see the golf course and the hatchery and avenues of lime trees. The distance between the trees was 9.1m and the distance from the trees was 18m.Sheep had grazed in the field. They had eaten them away at their height .The Oaks and Sweet Chestnuts were the biggest trees and were about 300 years old.There were lots of dead tree stumps.We could see the lake from where we were.There were some dredging machines.Behind the lake we could see Burghley house.It was facing south so that it would receive sunshine.The chimneys looked like towers.The trees by the house were conifers.In front of the lake sheep were grazing.
